label: News release announcing workers traveling to Columbia, S.C. to meet with legislative delegation of Charleston County
description: News release announcing workers traveling to Columbia, S.C. to meet with legislative delegation of Charleston County requesting their help in scheduling a meeting with Dr. William McCord.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
NEWS RElEASE Time - 7:30


the LPN and The non-professional employees at the Medical College of South
Carolina in Charleston are sending a group of workers to Columbia on
Wednesday to meet with the joint legislative delegation of Charleston
County. These workers are members of the Hospital Workers and Nursing
Home Employees, a union in Charleston.
These workers have petitions supporting them signed by over/2500
registered voters - businessmen, professional people, and interested
citizens.
"We want to speak about our hardships to the representatives we
have elected," and said Isaiah Bennett, organizer of hospital workers in
South Carolina. "We are having trouble in getting Dr. McCord to meet
with us. We want the legislature to help. We have been organized for
over a year. This is our last trip anywhere. If this attempt to arrange
a meeting with the hospital administration fails, we will come back
to Charleston and do whatever we have to do to achieve our goal.
